Description: The Department of Justice, the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and the state of Rhode Island announced that Bouchard Transportation Co. Inc. and its affiliates will pay more than $6 million to settle a portion of the federal and state natural resource damages claims for the April 2003 spill of up to 98,000 gallons of oil into Buzzards Bay.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Agency: U.S. Attorney-Eastern District of New York

Description: Bouchard Transportation agreed to pay $6 million to Massachusetts, Rhode Island and the federal government to resolve natural resource damage claims relating to the April 2003 spill of up to 98,000 gallons of oil into Buzzards Bay. The settlement was also announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-bouchard-transportation-co-inc

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: September 14, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: A Long Island-based petroleum barge company and three former and current management officials have paid $375,000 in restitution to the brother of one of two seamen killed in a barge explosion off the coast of Texas. The seaman alleged the company fired him for cooperating with investigators and reporting safety concerns to the U.S. Coast Guard. The explosion occurred on Oct. 20, 2017, off Port Aransas aboard the Buster Bouchard/B. No. 255.
Bouchard Transportation agreed to pay $11.45 million to settle a class action linked to a 2003 oil spill by one of its vessels that damaged 90 miles of shoreline around Buzzards Bay in Massachusetts.
Private Litigation Case Title: Gintis et al. v. Bouchard Transportation Co. Inc. et al.
